intro: Allium intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate onion, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and umbel-shaped flower clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, white or pale purple flowers. Its bulbous roots are used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb, similar to other allium species. Allium intermedium thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
